column1: #Text=Stimpy , Futurama , on the rough start that shaped his life
#Text=Philip J. Fry and Professor Hubert Farnsworth on Futurama .
#Text=You may not think you have ever heard Billy West , but chances are on a television program , a movie , a commercial , or as Howard Stern 's voice guru in the 1990 's , you have heard him .

#Text=West 's talent for creating personalities by twisting his voice has made him one of a handful of voice actors — Hank Azaria and the late Mel Blanc come to mind — who have achieved celebrity for their talent .

#Text=Indeed , West is one of the few voice actors who can impersonate Blanc in his prime , including characterizations of Bugs Bunny , Daffy Duck , Elmer Fudd and other characters from Warner Bros. cartoons .
#Text=What is the fulcrum in Mr. West 's life that led him to realize a talent to shape personalities with his voice , and how did the discovery of that gift shape him ? Wikinews reporter
#Text=David Shankbone found that like many great comedians , West faced more sour early in life than he did sweet .

#Text=The sour came from a physically and emotionally abusive alcoholic father ( " I could tell you the kind of night I was going to have from the sound of the key in the door or the way the car pulled up .
#Text=There is a point that you can reach in your life where you do n’t want to live , but you have n’t made the decision to die .
